tweet: A hospital in Bergamo, one of the Italian provinces most affected by the coronavirus, hit a milestone this week: No Covid-19 cases for the first time in 137 days  https://nyti.ms/2ZdKsyv  pic.twitter.com/TtYGIshOnX

tweet:

name: The New York Times
tweet: Patients older than 80 were at least 20 times more likely to die from Covid-19 than those in their 50s, and hundreds of times more likely to die than those below the age of 40. The study's lead author called the scale of this relationship “jaw-dropping."  https://nyti.ms/3f81p2V

name: The New York Times
tweet: President Jair Bolsonaro of Brazil said he would take another test for the coronavirus after a news report indicated he had developed symptoms of Covid-19  https://nyti.ms/2BNFOOG

name: The New York Times
tweet: A stretch of DNA linked to Covid-19 was passed down from Neanderthals 60,000 years ago, according to a new study  https://nyti.ms/38uqvqn

name: The New York Times
tweet:
At one South Korean hotel, 300 quarantined foreigners are met with loud daily protests from local residents, who want them out.

"This is a hotel that produced a confirmed Covid-19 case. Shut it down immediately!” a large banner outside the hotel reads.  https://nyti.ms/2YZRWow

name: The New York Times
tweet: "Let me say the quiet part loud: In the Covid-19 economy, you’re allowed only a kid or a job," writes Deb Perelman. "Why isn’t anyone talking about this?"  https://nyti.ms/2ZDESVk

name: The New York Times
tweet: In the Covid-19 economy, you can have a kid or a job. Not both.  https://nyti.ms/2ZvLQvj

name: The New York Times
tweet: Human challenge trials, in which healthy people get vaccinated and then deliberately exposed to a disease, may speed up a vaccine’s rollout. But many previous trials had “rescue medicines” to cure those who got sick — and there’s no cure for Covid-19.  http://nyti.ms/3f2xglm

name: The New York Times
tweet: "Let me say the quiet part loud: In the Covid-19 economy, you’re allowed only a kid or a job," writes Deb Perelman. "Why isn’t anyone talking about this?"  https://nyti.ms/2BlTxMM

tweet: It was another story at the prestigious medical centers in Manhattan, which have billions of dollars in endowments and cater largely to wealthy people with insurance. Their Covid-19 patients got access to heart-lung bypass machines and experimental drugs.  https://nyti.ms/3ikRol2

name: The New York Times
tweet: People who put off care as Covid-19 surged are easing back into the medical system. Here are some tips to help keep it safe.  https://nyti.ms/3ePphIn

tweet: Everything you love about your neighborhood bar makes it the ideal place to catch Covid-19  https://nyti.ms/2VvZ8GW

name: The New York Times
tweet:
Grace Fusco, the matriarch of a large New Jersey family, died in March from Covid-19 without knowing that her 2 oldest children died before her. 

The coronavirus ultimately killed 5 members of the Fusco family, and infected at least 19 others.

tweet:
Scammers are advertising fake or unapproved Covid-19 antibody tests as a way to obtain personal information that could be used for identity theft or medical insurance fraud, the FBI is warning

name: The New York Times
tweet: Until recently remdesivir was the only drug shown to help severely ill Covid-19 patients. But the benefits were modest, and the drug did not improve survival in those patients. Read more here.  https://nyti.ms/38cdKjT

tweet:
With most students and faculty dispersed, and a limited number able to return in the fall, college towns are confronting both Covid-19 and major losses in population and revenue.

tweet:
The CDC is preparing new guidelines for riding elevators, tight, indoor spaces where Covid-19 can easily travel from one person to the next. Here’s what the agency is considering:
🛑 Passenger limits
↔️ On / Off paths
😷 Masks
🤐 No small talk
 https://nyti.ms/2YFeRFS

tweet:
As health officials and political leaders downplayed or denied the risk of people with no symptoms spreading the coronavirus in February, tens of thousands of seemingly healthy people became an army of silent Covid-19 carriers.

tweet: Everything you love about your neighborhood bar — the ambience, the crowds, the music, the free-flowing alcohol — makes it the ideal place to catch Covid-19.  https://nyti.ms/3dyyMdE

name: The New York Times
tweet: Wearing a mask protects you and others from Covid-19. Here are some tips on making them work better for you.  https://nyti.ms/2VzWD6L

tweet:
In Opinion

"'The motherland is by your side,' China’s Covid-19 care package says. I frown at the glaring propaganda, then instantly feel embarrassed by my skeptical disposition," writes Yangyang Cheng.  https://nyti.ms/381nZrg

tweet:
The steroid dexamethasone could harm the health of people with mild cases of Covid-19 even as it appears to reduce deaths among those who are severely ill, according to more detailed data published by British researchers

tweet: Britain reduced its Covid-19 alert level, paving the way for easing of social-distancing measures even as the virus remains “in general circulation”  https://nyti.ms/2AQf7bO

tweet: Prime Minister Boris Johnson finally caught a few breaks this week, flustering his Labour opponent in Parliament and glorying in British researchers’ discovery of an effective treatment drug against Covid-19 symptoms  https://nyti.ms/3hDaHp7

tweet: Alan Hurwitz had a career in education before turning to bank heists in his 50s, robbing 18 banks in 3 months and earning the name “Zombie Bandit.” He died on June 6 of Covid-19. He was 79.  https://nyti.ms/3ea4cbg

name: The New York Times
tweet:
Representative Ilhan Omar, a Democratic congresswoman from Minnesota, said that her father had died from complications of Covid-19.

tweet: Thousands flocked to an Afghan herbalist who said he had invented a Covid-19 vaccine. Officials said tests showed it was a concoction of narcotics.  https://nyti.ms/3hneOWt

tweet: Immigrants in at least a dozen ICE facilities have announced protests and strikes, demanding measures to protect them from Covid-19 and that ICE release the sick, elderly and high-risk among them  https://nyti.ms/3e1Bsl5

tweet: A young woman whose lungs were destroyed by the coronavirus received a double lung transplant last week at Northwestern Memorial Hospital in Chicago, the first known lung transplant in the United States for Covid-19  https://nyti.ms/37rEvAv

tweet:
Haidari Wujodi, the mystic Afghan poet who for 50 years kept a corner desk at Kabul's public library teaching poetry, passed away on Wednesday. Local media said he was struggling with Covid-19. 

Read about his life in our profile of him last year.

name: The New York Times
tweet: Rarely has a vaccine been developed in less than 5 years. And yet the oft-cited target for creating a vaccine against Covid-19 is 12 months, 18 at the outside. Can it be done? For @NYTmag, Siddhartha Mukherjee spoke to a panel of experts to learn more. https://nyti.ms/2YgXABq

name: The New York Times
tweet: Rarely has a vaccine been developed in less than 5 years. And yet the oft-cited target for creating a vaccine against Covid-19 is 12 months, 18 at the outside. Can it be done? For @NYTmag, Siddhartha Mukherjee spoke to a panel of experts to learn more.  https://nyti.ms/2UsjMXQ

tweet:
Hecky Powell, whose South Side Chicago-style barbecue restaurant was an institution in Evanston, Illinois, has died from Covid-19 complications. He once advised a young Barack Obama and "was the unofficial mayor of Evanston," the city's actual mayor said.

tweet:

tweet: Watch as we ride along with these New York City medics who are used to transporting desperate patients to the hospital. Now, they must also counsel Covid-19 patients through life-or-death decisions: should they stay or should they go?  https://nyti.ms/2XWiwgF

name: The New York Times
tweet:
Ravi Sharma was doubled over when his dad found him. He couldn’t move the right side of his body, and could only grunt in his dad’s direction. 

The 27-year-old EMT was having a stroke. 

Doctors have reported a flurry of cases in Covid-19 patients.  https://nyti.ms/2z0z7HH

name: The New York Times
tweet:

Covid-19 outbreaks at meatpacking plants have created a backlog of pigs ready to be sent to slaughter, but with nowhere to go. Farmers are having to kill them.  https://nyti.ms/2WT2nIy

tweet: The man behind President Trump’s favorite unproven treatment for Covid-19 has made a career assailing orthodoxy. For @NYTmag, Scott Sayare profiled Didier Raoult. https://nyti.ms/3fHK8ye

tweet: Social media is already filling up with misinformation about a Covid-19 vaccine, months or years before one even exists. “The anti-vaxxers have been practicing for this,” writes @kevinroose. “And I’m worried that they will be unusually effective.” https://nyti.ms/360296C

tweet:

tweet:

name: The New York Times
tweet: As her condition worsened, doctors worried that Grandma Rocket’s lungs wouldn’t respond, and she’d become one of a substantial number of critically ill Covid-19 patients to reach a sort of “Twilight Zone,” where treatments plateau.  https://nyti.ms/2Su8dP5  pic.twitter.com/XS3R7sCcuQ

tweet: Russia’s prime minister, Mikhail V. Mishustin, said on Thursday that he was sick with Covid-19  https://nyti.ms/2YkyEKU  pic.twitter.com/a3mHctB0xE

name: The New York Times
tweet:
—South Korea and Hong Kong's governments have reached an exciting milestone: A day with no new local coronavirus cases
—A Covid-19 cluster is reported in Yemen, adding to its woes
—Russia’s newest black market is in ventilators
 https://nyti.ms/3f3FwlM

name: The New York Times
tweet: The coronavirus outbreak in New Orleans turned the Zulu club's Mardi Gras celebration from a joy into a tragedy. @NYTmag looks at the racial disparities of Covid-19 in America.  https://nyti.ms/3bQzJxU

name: The New York Times
tweet: In the absence of a vaccine or proven treatment, Covid-19 survivors are being viewed as potential saviors for patients with a disease for what is known as “convalescent plasma." This is the story of one frantic journey to find that help.  https://nyti.ms/2WeKB1Q

name: The New York Times
tweet:
A poll found that nearly half of New York City voters know someone who died of Covid-19.

74% of white voters said they did not know someone who died from the coronavirus, but 48% of black voters, and 52% of Latino voters, said they did.  https://nyti.ms/3aGF2ys  pic.twitter.com/42t70vpKLs

name: The New York Times
tweet: Rural hospitals in the U.S. have closed in increasing numbers in recent years. Our maps show where people have a hard time reaching a hospital that offers inpatient care needed to treat severe Covid-19.  https://nyti.ms/2W4lP4s

name: The New York Times
tweet:
Prescriptions for 2 antimalarial drugs surged on the day President Trump promoted them on TV as a coronavirus treatment. There is no proof they work against Covid-19.
 https://nyti.ms/3aygqb3

name: The New York Times
tweet:
The federal agency led by Dr. Anthony Fauci has since issued cautionary advice on the drugs.

On Friday, the FDA warned against using them outside of a hospital setting or clinical trial because they could lead to serious heart rhythm problems in Covid-19 patients.

name: The New York Times
tweet:
Prescriptions for two antimalarial drugs surged by over 46 times in the U.S. on the day President Trump promoted them on TV as a coronavirus treatment, according to a New York Times analysis.

There is no proof they work against Covid-19.  https://nyti.ms/3aDOJxu

name: The New York Times
tweet:
California, New Jersey and New York have made nursing homes accept Covid-19 patients who are considered stable enough to be released from hospitals. Residents and workers fear the policy is risking lives.
 https://nyti.ms/357VxlZ

name: The New York Times
tweet:
California, New Jersey and New York have made nursing homes accept Covid-19 patients who are considered stable enough to be released from hospitals. Residents and workers fear the policy is risking lives.
 https://nyti.ms/3eQwY1m

name: The New York Times
tweet:
Donald Reed Herring, Elizabeth Warren’s oldest brother, has died of Covid-19. He was 86.

“I’m grateful to the nurses and front-line staff who took care of him,” Warren wrote, “but it’s hard to know that there was no family to hold his hand.”
 https://nyti.ms/3eMcy9W

name: The New York Times
tweet: Afraid of Covid-19, parents across the U.S. are postponing well-child checkups. Immunizations are dropping at a dangerous rate, putting millions of children at risk of exposure to preventable deadly diseases.  https://nyti.ms/2xRFAUW

name: The New York Times
tweet:
In Opinion

Nicholas Eberstadt writes, “Outsiders have no real way of gauging whether the Covid-19 epidemic is a threat to the North Korean regime’s very survival, but the leadership seems to be reacting as if it thinks so.”  https://nyti.ms/2XY3oBg

name: The New York Times
tweet:
A Covid-19 death on February 6 in Santa Clara County, California — 20 days before what was previously thought to be the first death in the U.S. — has changed the picture of what the country was contending with by the time government officials took action
 https://nyti.ms/3cGYU5Q

name: The New York Times
tweet:
"You would think that being sheltered in place means you have more control, but I actually feel a deep loss of control." 

This is what it's like inside a South Bronx apartment when you have Covid-19 and a family of 8 to care for.  https://nyti.ms/2yydU7C

name: The New York Times
tweet: New Covid-19 treatment guidelines from the agency led by Dr. Anthony Fauci undercut President Trump’s promotion of some unproven drugs  https://nyti.ms/3bnQAI9

name: The New York Times
tweet: The difference between official Covid-19 deaths and the number of people who died beyond what would be expected in a typical year is particularly stark in countries that have been slow to acknowledge the scope of the virus.  https://nyti.ms/3eHn0iM  pic.twitter.com/vYAnriAtN9

name: The New York Times
tweet: Disparities between the total rise in deaths and the reported Covid-19 deaths can reflect limited testing for the virus. Some countries are counting only those who died in hospitals.  https://nyti.ms/3eHn0iM  pic.twitter.com/ZeJ8ffiZJQ

name: The New York Times
tweet: Many thousands more people have died in Europe this year compared with a normal year. But deaths officially attributed to Covid-19 account for just a fraction of the increase, suggesting many more died from the virus than have been counted.  https://nyti.ms/3eHn0iM  pic.twitter.com/LNA2lIBGl6

name: The New York Times
tweet: The coronavirus is far deadlier than official numbers show. A New York Times analysis of 11 countries found that at least 28,000 more people have died in the last month than is reflected in official Covid-19 death counts for those nations.  https://nyti.ms/3eHn0iM

name: The New York Times
tweet:
When Brittainy Newman had mild Covid-19 symptoms, her mother had to fight the instinct to be close in their shared New York apartment. 

“Isolation is hard. We are wired for connection.”  https://nyti.ms/2KotJAg  pic.twitter.com/CGcMTSWrAS

name: The New York Times
tweet: LabCorp said it would first make the tests available to health care workers and emergency workers who may have been exposed to Covid-19 or be symptomatic, and that it would be making the self-collection kits available to consumers “in the coming weeks”  https://nyti.ms/3eEqbaV

name: The New York Times
tweet:
Covid-19, the illness caused by the coronavirus, is arguably the leading cause of death in the U.S. right now. 

More than 20 experts in public health, medicine, epidemiology and history shared their thoughts on what to expect in the year ahead.  https://nyti.ms/3bABQG9  pic.twitter.com/0tG4sIcgL3

name: The New York Times
tweet:
By the time Luis Arellano was finally admitted to a hospital — the third one he visited — his body had already been ravaged by Covid-19.

"Keep fighting because you’re very strong," his son wrote in his last Whatsapp message to him.
 https://nyti.ms/3coqhBM

name: The New York Times
tweet: The FDA eased its rules and allowed antibody tests, many made in China, to be sold in the U.S. without formal review. The agency has since warned that some firms marketing antibody tests falsely claimed that they had federal approval or that they could diagnose Covid-19.  pic.twitter.com/PIZ3flWlMz

name: The New York Times
tweet: Nearly 60% of sailors from France's flagship aircraft carrier, the Charles de Gaulle, tested positive for Covid-19. 3 months later, this has led to questions, finger-pointing and investigations.  https://nyti.ms/2XUkXlo

name: The New York Times
tweet:
Covid-19 is arguably the leading cause of death in the U.S. right now. It has killed over 1,800 Americans almost every day since April 7 — heart disease typically kills 1,774 Americans a day, and cancer kills 1,641.

Here's what experts say to expect next.
 https://nyti.ms/2xFfVyG

name: The New York Times
tweet: An unexpected surge in Covid-19 patients with kidney failure has left doctors facing new life-and-death calculations as demand for dialysis soars  https://nyti.ms/2ROXwWU

name: The New York Times
tweet:
Immunity will become a societal advantage.

“It will be a frightening schism,” Dr. David Nabarro, a WHO special envoy on Covid-19 predicted. “Those with antibodies will be able to travel and work, and the rest will be discriminated against.”  https://nyti.ms/2VjUNXK  pic.twitter.com/UXy5ClNLQB

name: The New York Times
tweet: Raymond Copeland raised 3 girls as a single father after their mother died. His job with the NYC Department of Sanitation put him on the front lines as an essential employee. He died from complications of Covid-19 at 46.  https://nyti.ms/3eBaW2O

name: The New York Times
tweet: The shortage of personal protective equipment in the U.S. means few clinical interpreters are able to work in person with Covid-19 patients. “Someone’s oxygen can be dropping and I have to get an interpreter on the phone," one doctor said.  https://nyti.ms/2RM93qd

name: The New York Times
tweet: An editor on the Obituaries desk, @danwakin, contributed to our Portraits of Grief series in which we profiled the victims of the Sept. 11, 2001 terror attacks. He now shares how we're working to convey the toll of Covid-19 in Those We've Lost.  https://nyti.ms/2Vyjui2

name: The New York Times
tweet: Covid-19 is on track to kill far more people in the United States this year than the seasonal flu. But determining just how deadly the coronavirus will be is a key question for epidemiologists, who expect waves of infection that could last into 2022.  https://nyti.ms/2Vulwzy

tweet:
Rural hospitals have few or no intensive care beds, ventilators or critical care specialists. Here’s how one hospital, with a single doctor caring for inpatients, handled a Covid-19 surge.

tweet:

tweet: A family of 3 gets sick with Covid-19 symptoms. Who has it? Dr. Lisa Sanders explores for @NYTmag. https://nyti.ms/2RC9z9R

name: The New York Times
tweet: The EPA will not tighten a regulation on industrial soot emissions, the agency's head announced. The regulation came up for review ahead of the coronavirus pandemic, but the decision disregards an emerging link between dirty air and Covid-19 death rates.  https://nyti.ms/2xvjszl

name: The New York Times
tweet: Last week, the CDC issued guidelines saying it is OK for essential employees to keep working after potential exposure to Covid-19 if certain conditions are met. Workers’ rights advocates fear that safety standards for food workers are eroding.  https://nyti.ms/3a4srEZ

name: The New York Times
tweet:
Basharrie McKenzie is another expectant mother who spent time in the Brooklyn Hospital Center ICU with Covid-19.

name: The New York Times
tweet:
Precious, a substitute teacher, called Dr. Byer on March 26, feeling sick but scared to come to the hospital. A day later, she had to be admitted with coughing and labored breathing — a "classic" Covid-19 case, he said.

24 hours after that, she was in the ICU on a ventilator.  pic.twitter.com/OUfewcrvoD

tweet:

tweet: While out working, Frazzetta called his mother. She had a fever that was going up and down, she said. He heard her cough. Soon his mother was diagnosed with Covid-19 and hospitalized.

tweet:

tweet: “Many people working in the hospitals — doctors, nurses, so many of us — are parents.” Across the U.S., workers who are responding to the coronavirus pandemic are fighting to retain custody of their children amid fears of Covid-19.  https://nyti.ms/39XReuA

tweet:
